author: Syed Sajjad Ali
text:
In a relief to the people of Tripura, which shares the border with Bangladesh on three sides, a Passport Seva Kendra was finally opened here on Thursday.

Minister of State for External Affairs Gen. (retd.) V.K. Singh, however, failed to turn up for the inauguration. State Information and Finance Minister Bhanulal Saha filled in for him.

The successive governments in the State had demanded a passport office because applications were processed in the Kolkata regional passport office.

The troubles increased after the handwritten passport was prohibited and machine-readable passport was made compulsory in November last.
title: Agartala gets Passport Seva Kendra
